stories.text:
Hacker News has a unique feature that reddit and other forums don't have - the "hide" button.

In theory, you may scan through the titles and click "hide" on each one you know you won't read. The benefit is when you come back later next time, you won't have to scan through those titles again.

This sounds great, except nobody does it, because it's too many clicks.

This chrome extension solves this with keyboard:

[↑] [↓]: go up and down the list

[←]: not interested / hide

[→]: open link (background new tab)

[Enter]: open link (foreground new tab)

[Space]: open comments

Github: https://github.com/ZYinMD/hacker-news-keyboard-navigation
stories.title: Show HN: Hacker News keyboard navigation [Chrome extension]

stories.text: Hi all! I'm a tech lead and am looking for book recommendations that help me become a better engineer. I have read The Pragmatic Programmer and am looking for similar books, with best practices like daily builds, bugtracking, etc.
stories.title: [Ask HN] Good books with engineering best practices like daily builds?
